title: Pre-Teen Improv at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Don't miss out on the fun!!! Sign up your kids, grand kids, nieces, nephews, even the stinky neighbor kid from down the street for KidProv at the Push Comedy Theater.

This class is open to children ages 8 to 12. Students will explore the key elements of both long and short form improvisation. The children will play numerous improv games which will serve to develop and enhance their public-speaking, social and team-building skills.

This class will be conducted in a non-judgmental environment where the students will build confidence, make friends and most importantly ... have fun



The safety of our students and our teachers are first and foremost.

-Classes will be held across the street at The Plot.

-We will meet at the Theater for check-in, then move to The Plot.

-Social distancing will be maintained and masks will be worn when students aren't on stage.

-We will move to the theater on days of inclement weather.

-

Prerequisites: none

This class will be held from 10m - 12pm on Saturday afternoons from September 12th through October 17th.





The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts.

The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting and film production.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Improv for Teens at the Push Comedy Theater
description:
Jump head first into the wonderful worlds of sketch and improv comedy. This class is open to teens from the ages of 13 to 17.

Absolutely no experience is needed.

Students will explore the key tools behind both long and short form improvisation. We will play numerous games to help you sharpen your mind.

We strive to create a safe, non-judgmental environment where teens can build confidence, make friends and most importantly... have fun.



The safety of our students and our teachers are first and foremost.

-Classes will be held across the street at The Plot.

-We will meet at the Theater for check-in, then move to The Plot.

-Social distancing will be maintained and masks will be worn when students aren't on stage.

-We will move to the theater on days of inclement weather.

-



Prerequisites: none

This class will be held from 1pm - 3pm on Saturday afternoons from September 12th through October 17th.

This is class is $180 for new students and $160 for returning students.

--

The Push Comedy Theater is a 99 seat venue in the heart of Norfolk's brand new Arts District. Founded by local comedy group The Pushers, the Push Comedy Theater is dedicated to bringing you live comedy from the best local and national acts. The Push Comedy Theater hosts live sketch, improv and stand-up comedy on Friday and Saturday nights. During the week classes are offered in stand-up, sketch and improv comedy as well as acting.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

title: Improv 101 with Brad McMurran
description:
Jump into the wonderful and wild world of improv comedy!!!

Learn the beginnings of Chicago-based, long form improv. Students will learn how to create scenes based off of audience suggestions. They will learn the fundamentals of 'Yes, And,' how to support scene partners' ideas and energy, and how to make strong character choices. 

Absolutely no experience in acting or comedy is needed. The Push Comedy Theater strives to create a fun, safe, and supportive experience for all students.

This is a six week class that meets every Monday from 6:30 PM to 8:30 PM starting September 21st. Graduation shows are currently delayed until further notice. 
Cost: $200
This class caps at 8 students. Current social distancing measures will be taken. 

Please email pusherscomedy@gmail.com to be added to our wait list with the subject "Improv 101 Wait List".

About the instructor:
Brad McMurran is the founder of The Pushers Sketch and Improv Comedy Troupe. He is the co-head writer, performer, and artistic director of the Push Comedy Theater. 
Brad studied acting at ODU, trained in improvisation at Upright Citizen's Brigades, and is the co-writer of the off-Broadway hit, Cuff Me; The 50 Shades of Grey Musical Parody.

Whether you're a die-hard comedy lover or a casual fan... a seasoned performer or someone who's never stepped foot on stage... the Push Comedy Theater has something for you.

Yes, and any questions? Email pusherscomedy@gmail.com
